intro: Arthrostylidium cacuminis, commonly known as the Cape York lily, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are usually broad and sword-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences with distinct sepals and petals. Arthrostylidium cacuminis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
